title.rendered: “IDF and Shin Bet Launch Major Anti-Terror Operation: 18 Arrests and Weapons Seized in Jordan Valley”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF and Shin Bet forces launched an operation overnight in the ‘Fara’ area of the Jordan Valley Brigade; the forces are currently engaged in exchanges of fire with terrorists, during which one terrorist was eliminated; IDF, Shin Bet, and Border Police forces arrested 18 wanted individuals across the Central Command area overnight.

IDF and Shin Bet forces initiated a battalion-level operation to combat terrorism in the Fara area of the Jordan Valley Brigade.
The fighters have thus far arrested three wanted individuals, destroyed explosives, and are currently engaged in exchanges of fire with armed terrorists, during which one terrorist was eliminated and further hits on more terrorists were identified. The operation is ongoing at this time.

In the villages of Pkua, Romana, and Danaba in the Menashe Brigade, the fighters arrested four wanted individuals and eliminated an armed terrorist.

In Beita and Dura within the Judea Brigade, the forces apprehended three wanted individuals; in Tarqumiyah within the brigade’s jurisdiction, the fighters arrested another wanted person and confiscated weapons.

In Qalqilya within the Ephraim Brigade, the forces seized two pistols, and in the villages of Tal and Zawata within the Samaria Brigade, three wanted individuals were arrested. In Ramun and Beitunia in Benjamin, two wanted individuals were apprehended, and a firearm was confiscated.

The arrested individuals and the confiscated weapons have been handed over for further processing by security forces, and there were no injuries reported to our forces.

Since the beginning of the war, approximately 4,150 wanted individuals have been arrested across the Judea and Samaria Division and within the Jordan Valley Brigade, around 1,750 of whom are affiliated with the terrorist organization Hamas.

Attached is a photo of the confiscated firearms in Qalqilya: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC100620248429084

Attached is documentation of the forces’ activity in Qalqilya: https://bit.ly/3RipDMQ

Attached are photos from the forces’ activity in Qalqilya: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC10062024698765454
